required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Clinical Study Evaluating Sedation of Intravenous Administration of HSK3486 in ICU Patients Undergoing Long-Term Mechanical Ventilation
clinical_study.official_title: A Multi-Center, Randomized, Open-Label, Propofol-Controlled Exploratory Clinical Study Evaluating Sedation of Intravenous Administration of HSK3486 Injectable Emulsion in ICU Patients Undergoing Long-Term Mechanical Ventilation

brief_summary.textblock: This is a multi-center, randomized, open-label, propofol-controlled exploratory clinical study. In this study, 20 ICU patients undergoing mechanical ventilation are expected to be enrolled and will be randomly assigned to the HSK3486 group and the propofol group in a 1:1 ratio. This study is not blinded as it is open-label.

primary_outcome.description: the mean duration of RASS being in the range of -1 to -2 per hour during the study medication provided that no remedial medication is used

secondary_outcome.description: the time for the subject to recover from sedation to full recovery of consciousness (RASS ≥ 0) after discontinuation of drug administration.

the time from intubation (applicable to patients who undergoes intubation after entering the ICU)/ICU admission (applicable to patients with intubation before entering the ICU) to extubation or the time from drug discontinuation to extubation

intervention.description: Loading Dose：0.1 mg/kg，Maintenance Dose：Maintenance is started at 0.3 mg/kg/h, and the dose can be adjusted up and down by 0.05-0.1 mg/kg/h.
Loading Dose：0.5 mg/kg，Maintenance Dose：Maintenance is started at1.5 mg/kg/h, and the dose can be adjusted up and down by 0.25-0.5mg/kg/h.
